text.front:
Manuscript
submitted to
Website: http://AIMsciences.org
AIMS' Journals
Volume X, Number 0X, XX 200X
pp. X-XX
AN ATTEMPT AT CLASSIFYING HOMOGENIZATION-BASED NUMERICAL MATHODS
Emmanuel Frénod
Université de Bretagne-Sud, UMR 6205, LMBA,
F-56000 Vannes, France
AND
Projet INRIA Calvi, Université de Strasbourg, IRMA,
7 rue René Descartes, F-67084 Strasbourg Cedex, France
(Communicated by the associate editor name)
Abstract.
In this note, a classification of Homogenization-Based Numerical Methods and (in
particular) of Numerical Methods that are based on the Two-Scale Convergence is done. In this
classification stand: Direct Homogenization-Based Numerical Methods; H-Measure-Based Nu-
merical Methods; Two-Scale Numerical Methods and TSAPS: Two-Scale Asymptotic Preserving
Schemes.
2000 Mathematics Subject Classification. Primary: 65L99, 65M99, 65N99.
Key words and phrases. Homogenization-Based Numerical Mathods; Homogenization; Asymptotic Analysis; As-
ymptotic Expansion; Numerical Simulation.
